title: Drawing, "Triumphal Arch with the Royal Swedish Coat of Arms", 1767
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, over graphite, ruled border in pen and black ink, green wash on paper
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, bottom right: Taraval; in pen and black ink, within ruled border: inv. Taraval fecit.
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, upper right, within ruled border (by later hand), in pen and black ink: D. 62. Inscribed in pen and brown ink, verso: Projet demand de Su de pour la ville de Stockholm en l767- / dessin et compos par L.G. Taraval, architecte, inspecteur des batimens du Roi / L G T (enclosed in monogram)
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, l896, no. 541, ); Leon Decloux (acquired after l906)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The triumphal arch, depicted at center, in mid-distance, consists of a higher central and two lower lateral archways.  Above the central arch is a chariot with two allegorical women. On the ground, seven small-scale men and a woman (and even one accompanying dog) promenade below the arch, pointing or looking at it.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Triumphal Arch with the Royal Swedish Coat of Arms", 1767.
1767. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, over graphite, ruled border in pen and black ink, green wash on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-282.
